intro: Acetosella alata, commonly known as the silverweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or upright growth habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically rounded and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces white or pinkish flowers in clusters, often blooming in early spring. Acetosella alata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
